content.text: The universal set \(\mathcal{E}\) and the sets \(A\) and \(B\) shown in the Venn diagram below are such
In the Venn diagram below insert the number of elements in the set represented by each of the four regions
In the Venn diagram below shade the region that represents \((P \cup Q) \cap R'\)
On the grid below, draw on the same axes, for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\), the graphs of \(y = \sin x\)
and \(y = 1 + \cos 2x\)
State the number of roots of the equation \(\sin x = 1 + \cos 2x\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\)
Without extending your graphs state the number of roots of the equation \(\sin x = 1 + \cos 2x\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\)
It is given that \(2x - 1\) is a factor of the expression \(4x^{3} + ax^{2} - 11x + b\) and that the remain
when the expression is divided by \(x + 2\) is 25. Find the remainder when the expression is di
Calculate \(\mathbf{AB}\)
Calculate \(\mathbf{BC}\)
Find the inverse matrix, \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}\)

It is given that \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 & -2 \\ 1 & -5 \end{pmatrix}, \mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & -4 \\ -3 & 5 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{C} = \begin{pmatrix} 4 \\ 2 \\ -7 \end{pmatrix}\)
the boys and girls sit alternately,
the boys sit together and the girls sit together,
a boy sits at each end of the row
Four boys and three girls are to be seated in a row. Calculate the number of different ways
this can be done if
Given that the perimeter of the garden is greater than \(140\mathrm{m}\), write down a linear inequality in \(x\)
Given that the area of the garden is less than \(3000 \text{m}^2\), write down a quadratic inequality in \(x\)
By solving these two inequalities, find the set of possible values of \(x\)
The length of a rectangular garden is \(x \mathrm{m}\) and the width of the garden is \(10 \mathrm{m}\) less than the
Find the angle \(\theta\) in radians
Find the perimeter of the region \(BCFE\)

In the diagram \(AD\) and \(BE\) are arcs of concentric circles centre \(O\), where \(OA = 6 \text{cm}\) and \(AB = 8 \text{cm}\). The area of the region \(ABED\) is \(32 \text{cm}^2\). The triangle \(OCF\) is isosceles with \(OC = OF = 20 \text{cm}\)
Find the value of \(t\) when the velocity of the particle first equals \(2 \mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\)
Find the acceleration of the particle when \(t = 3\)
Find the distance of the particle from \(O\) when it first comes to instantaneous rest
A particle travels in a straight line so that, \(t\) s after passing through a fixed point \(O\), its vel
\(v \mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\), is given by \(v = 12 \cos \left(\frac{t}{3}\right)\)
Find the value of \(a\), of \(b\) and of \(c\) for which \(\mathrm{f}(x) = a(x + b)^2 + c\)
Sketch the graph of \(y = |\mathrm{f}(x)|\) for \(-1 \leqslant x \leqslant 7\)
Find the set of values of \(k\) for which the equation \(|\mathrm{f}(x)| = k\) has 4 distinct roots
It is given that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 2x^{2} - 12x + 10.\)
Find the coordinates of the point \(Q\)
Find the area of the region enclosed by the curve and the line \(PQ\)
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = x^{3} - 9x^{2} + 24x + 2\) cutting the \(y\)-axis at the point \(P\). The curve has a minimum point at \(Q\)
Given that \(\overrightarrow{AX} = \mu \overrightarrow{AB}\), where \(\mu\) is a constant, express \(\overrightarrow{OX}\) in terms of \(\mu\), \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\)
Given that \(\overrightarrow{SX} = \lambda \overrightarrow{ST}\), where \(\lambda\) is a constant, express \(\overrightarrow{OX}\) in terms of \(\lambda\), \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\)
Hence evaluate \(\mu\) and \(\lambda\)

In the diagram above \(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a}, \overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b}, \overrightarrow{OS} = \frac{3}{5} \overrightarrow{OA}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OT} = \frac{7}{5} \overrightarrow{OB}\)
Find, in terms of \(\mathbf{c}\) and/or \(\mathbf{d}\), the vectors \(\overrightarrow{OP}, \overrightarrow{OQ}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OR}\)
Show that the points \(P\), \(Q\) and \(R\) are collinear and find the ratio \(PQ:QR\)
In the diagram above \(\overrightarrow{OC} = \mathbf{c}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OD} = \mathbf{d}\). The points \(P\) and \(Q\) lie on \(OC\) and \(OD\) produced
respectively, so that \(OC:CP = 1:2\) and \(OD:DQ = 2:1\). The line \(CD\) is extended to \(R\) so that \(CD = DR\)
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives
